English Sentences: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagee Daawita zarenne Abrahaama zare gidida Yesuus Kiristtoosa yeletaa yootiya maxaafaa.

English Sentences: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami Yisaaqa yeliis; Yisaaqi Yaaqooba yeliis; Yaaqoobi Yihudaanne a ishantta yeliis.

English Sentences: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai Ti7imaaro giyo maccaaseeppe Paareesanne Zaraaha yeliis; Paareesi Hexiroona yeliis; Hexirooni Raama yeliis.

English Sentences: And Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;
Wolaitta Sentences: Raami Aminadaaba yeliis; Aminadaabi Na7asoona yeliis; Na7asooni Solomona yeliis.

English Sentences: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;
Wolaitta Sentences: Solomoni Ra7aabo giyo maccaaseeppe Boo7eeza yeliis; Boo7eezi Uruto giyo maccaaseeppe Yobeeda yeliis; Yobeedi Isseya yeliis.

English Sentences: And Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias;
Wolaitta Sentences: Isseyi Kawuwaa Daawita yeliis. Kawoi Daawiti Solomona yeliis. Solomona aayyiyaa koiro Ooriyoona giyoogaa machchiyo.

English Sentences: And Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;
Wolaitta Sentences: Solomoni Robi7aama yeliis; Robi7aami Abiiya yeliis; Abiiyi Asaafa yeliis.

English Sentences: And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaafi Yoosaafixa yeliis; Yoosaafixi Yoraama yeliis; Yoraami Ooziyaana yeliis.

English Sentences: And Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooziyaani Yo7aataama yeliis; Yo7aataami Akaaza yeliis; Akaazi Hizqqiyaasa yeliis.

English Sentences: And Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hizqqiyaasi Minaasa yeliis; Minaasee Amoona yeliis; Amooni Yoosiyaasa yeliis.

English Sentences: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asai omoodettidi, Baabiloone biitti biido wode, Yoosiyaasi Yo7aakiinanne a ishantta yeliis.

English Sentences: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai omoodetti Baabiloone biitti biidoogaappe guyyiyan, Yo7aakiini Salaatiyaala yeliis; Salaatiyaali Zarubaabeela yeliis.

English Sentences: And Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;
Wolaitta Sentences: Zarubaabeeli Abiyuuda yeliis; Abiyuudi Eliyaaqiima yeliis; Eliyaaqiimi Azoora yeliis.

English Sentences: And Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;
Wolaitta Sentences: Azoori Xaadooqa yeliis; Xaadooqi Akiima yeliis; Akiimi Eliyuuda yeliis.

English Sentences: And Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eliyuudi El77aazara yeliis; El77aazari Maataana yeliis; Maataani Yaaqooba yeliis.

English Sentences: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi Kiristtoosa giyo Yesuusa yelida Mairaami azinaa Yooseefa yeliis.

English Sentences: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, zare ubbai Abrahaamappe Daawita gakkanaassi tammanne oidda; Daawitappe doommidi, asai Baabiloone biitti omoodettidi biido wode gakkanaassi tammanne oidda; asai Baabiloone biitti omoodettidi biido wodeppe Kiristtoosi yelettido wodiyaa gakkanaassi tammanne oidda.

English Sentences: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuus Kiristtoosa yeletai hagaa mala; a aayyiyaa Mairaama Yooseefayyo giigaasu; a he wode Yooseefaara gaittennan de7aidda, Geeshsha Ayyaanau shahaaraasu.

English Sentences: Then Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not willing to make her a publick example, was minded to put her away privily.
Wolaitta Sentences: O giigissi wottida Yooseefi, xillo asa gididaagee, o kaushshanau koyibeenna; ibaa qonccissennan o aggi bayanau qoppiis.

English Sentences: But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the LORD appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i hegaa qoppishin, Godaa kiitanchchai aimuwan aara gaittidi, "Daawita na7au Yooseefaa, Mairaama Geeshsha Ayyaanau shahaarido gishshau, o ekkanaagaa yayyoppa.

English Sentences: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.
Wolaitta Sentences: Attuma na7a a yelana; qassi neeni Yesuusa gaada a sunttana; aissi giikko, i ba asaa eta nagaraappe ashshana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Godai hananabaa yootiyaagaa baggaara,

English Sentences: Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being interpreted is, God with us.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Geela7iyaa shahaarada na7aa yelana; a sunttai Amaanu7eela geetettana" giidoogee polettana mala, hagee ubbai haniis; "Amaanu7eela" giyoogee "Xoossai nunaara de7ees" giyoogaa.

English Sentences: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi xiskkuwaappe beegottidi, Godaa kiitanchchai bana azazidoogaadan, Mairaamo efiis.

English Sentences: And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ba baira na7aa a yelana gakkanaassi o bochchibeenna; qassi na7aa Yesuusa giidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Yihudaa biittan Beetaliheeme giyo kataman Heeroodisi kawotidi de7iyo wode yelettiis; hegaappe guyyiyan, xoolinttiyaa paidiya asati arshsho baggappe Yerusalaame yiidi,

English Sentences: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aihuda kawo gidanau yelettida na7ai awan de7ii? Aissi giikko, nuuni arshsho baggaara kiyida a xoolinttiyaa be7idi, ayyo goinnanau yiida" yaagidi oichchidosona.

English Sentences: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Heeroodisi, hegaa siyidi dagammiis; Yerusalaamen de7iya asai ubbaikka dagammiis.

English Sentences: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heeroodisi qeese halaqata ubbatanne higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeta xeesidi, "Kiristtoosi awan yelettanddeeshsha?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin eti zaaridi, "Yihudaa biittan Beetaliheeme kataman yelettana.

English Sentences: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiyaagee, Yihudaa biittan de7iya Beetaliheemee, neeni Yihudaa biittaa haariyaageetuppe ainne laafakka. Aissi giikko, ta asaa, Israa7eela haariyaagee neeppe kiyana giidi xaafiis" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Heeroodisi arshsho baggappe yiida asata geeman xeesidi, xoolinttee etau beettido wodiyaa etappe geeshshidi eriis.

English Sentences: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi Beetaliheeme eta yeddiiddi, "Biidi na7aa mintti koyite; a demmido wode taanikka baada ayyo goinnanaadan, tana erissite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti kawoi giidoogaa siyidi biidosona; biiddi ogiyan arshsho baggaara eti kase be7ido xoolinttiyaa be7idosona; he xoolinttee na7ai de7iyoosaa gakkidi eqqana gakkanaassi, eta kaalettiis.

English Sentences: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti he xoolinttiyaa be7ido wode, zawai bainna daro ufaissaa ufaittidosona.

English Sentences: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Soo gelidi, na7ai ba aayee Mairaamiira de7iyaagaa be7idosona; gulbbatidi ayyo goinnidosona; hegaappe guyyiyan, bantta saaxiniyaa dooyidi, worqqaa, ixaanaanne karbbiyaa ayyo immidosona.

English Sentences: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Heeroodisakko simmenna mala, Xoossai aimuwan eta, "Inttena erite" gin hara ogiyaara bantta dere simmidosona.

English Sentences: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti biidoogaappe guyyiyan, Godaa kiitanchchai aimuwan Yooseefayyo beettidi, "Heeroodisi na7aa woranau koyiyo gishshau, denddada na7aanne na7aa aayyiyo ekkada Gibxxe biitti baqata; taani neeyyo odana gakkanaassi, yan uttaashsha" yaagiis.

English Sentences: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefi qammi denddidi, na7aanne na7aa aayyiyo ekkidi, Gibxxe biitti biis;

English Sentences: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godai hananabaa yootiyaagaa baggaara, "Taani ta na7aa Gibxxe biittaappe xeesaas" giidoogee polettana mala, Heeroodisi haiqqana gakkanaassikka i yan de7iis.

English Sentences: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Heeroodisi arshsho baggappe yiidaageeti bana cimmidoogaa erido wode, daro hanqqettiis; hanqqettidi xoolinttee kase beettido wodiyaabaa etappe siyidoogaadankka, wotaaddarata yeddidi, Beetaliheemeeninne Beetaliheeme heeran de7iya naa77u laitta attuma naatanne qassi naa77u laittappe guuxxiya attuma naata ubbaa worissiis.

English Sentences: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiya Ermmaasi,

English Sentences: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yeehoinne zilaassai Raama giyo kataman siyettiis; Raaheela ba naatuyyo yeekkausu. Eti haiqqiichchido gishshau, agga gin, aggennan ixxaasu" giidi haasayidoogee polettiis.

English Sentences: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Heeroodisi haiqqidoogaappe guyyiyan, Godaa kiitanchchai Gibxxe biittan de7iya Yooseefayyo aimuwan beettidi

English Sentences: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.
Wolaitta Sentences: a, "Dendda; na7aanne na7aa aayyiyo ekkada, Israa7eela biitti simma; aissi giikko, na7aa woranau koyiyaageeti haiqqiichchidosona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefi denddidi, na7aanne na7aa aayyiyo ekkidi, Israa7eela simmiis.

English Sentences: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yooseefi Arkkelawoosi ba aawaa Heeroodisa sohuwan Yihudaa biittan kawotidoogaa siyido wode, yaa baanau yayyiis; Xoossai ayyo aimuwan yootin, Galiila biitti biis.

English Sentences: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiyaageeti, "Asai a, Naazireeta asa giidi Xeesana" giidoogee polettana mala, Naazireeta giyo katamaa biidi de7iis.

English Sentences: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Xammaqiya Yohaannisi asaa,

English Sentences: And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Saluwaa kawotettai matattido gishshau, intte nagaraappe simmite" yaagiiddi, Yihudaa Bazzuwan yootiiddi yiis.

English Sentences: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hananabaa yootiya Isiyaasi, Yohaannisabaa yootiiddi, "Issoi bazzon ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, Godaa ogiyaa giigissite. I hemettana loossuwaakka ayyo sitti oottite giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the same John had his raiment of camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yohaannisau gaameelaa ikisiyan dadettida afalai de7ees; qassi ba xeessan dafuwaa gixxees; i miyo qumaikka boolenne degeera eessa.

English Sentences: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai he wode Yerusalaameppe, Yihudaa biitta ubbasaappenne Yorddaanoosa giyo shaafaa heeran de7iya biitta ubbaappe akko yees.

English Sentences: And were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yiidi ba nagaraa paaxin, Yorddaanoosa giyo shaafan asaa xammaqiis.

English Sentences: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yohaannisi daro Parisaawetinne Saaduqaaweti xammaqettanau baakko yiyaageeta be7idi, eta hagaadan yaagiis; "Ha shooshshatoo, Xoossaa hanqqoi yaana haniyaagaappe baqatana mala, intteyyo oonee odidai?

English Sentences: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi intte intte nagaraappe simmidoogaa erissiyaabaa oottite.

English Sentences: And think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte intte wozanan, Abrahaami nu aawaa giidi qoppoppite. Aissi giikko, taani inttessi yootais; Xoossai ha shuchchata Abrahaamassi na7a kessanaukka danddayees.

English Sentences: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: Beexee mittaa xaphuwan qanxxanau giigi uttiis; lo77o aifiyaa aifenna mitta ubbai qanxxettidi, taman yegettana.

English Sentences: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte intte nagaraappe simmidoogaa erissanau, taani inttena haattan xammaqais; shin taappe guyyeera yiyaagee, inttena Geeshsha Ayyaanaaninne taman xammaqana. I taappe daro minnees; taani harai atto a caammaa tookkanaukka bessikke.

English Sentences: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: A kushiyan kattaa suraggiyo laidai de7ees. Kattaa qoxxiyo audiyaa keehi geeshshees; ba gisttiyaa gootaran qolana; shin dalaa to77enna taman xuuggana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi he wode Yohaannisan xammaqettanau, Galiilappe Yorddaanoosa giyo shaafaa akko biis.

English Sentences: But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yohaannisi a, "Taani nenan xammaqettanau koyiyo wode neeni taakko yai?" yaagidi, a qofaa laammanau koyiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it to be so now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffered him.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi zaaridi a, "Nuuni xillotetta ooso ubbaa hagaadan polanau bessiyo gishshau, ha77i tau eeno ga" yaagiis. Yaagin Yohaannisi au eeno giis.

English Sentences: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi xammaqettidoogaappe guyyiyan, sohuwaara haattaappe kiyiis; saloi dooyettin, Xoossaa Ayyaanai haraphphedan yiishiininne ba bolli wodhdhishin be7iis;

English Sentences: And lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
Wolaitta Sentences: qassi saluwaappe, "Taani siiqiyo ta Na7ai, tana ufaissiyaagee hagaa" yaagiya qaalai yiis.

English Sentences: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, xalahe halaqai Yesuusa paaccana mala, Geeshsha Ayyaanai bazzo Yesuusa efiis.

English Sentences: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.
Wolaitta Sentences: Efin Yesuusi oitamu gallassaanne oitamu qammaa xoomidoogaappe guyyiyan namisettiis.

English Sentences: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xalahe halaqai yiidi a, "Neeni Xoossaa Na7a gidikko, ane ha shuchchati oitta gidana mala azaza" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi zaaridi, "Xoossaa maxaafai, Asi Xoossai haasayiyo qaala ubban de7anaappe attin, oitta xalaalan de7enna yaagees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, xalahe halaqai Yesuusa geeshsha katamaa efiidi, Beeta Maqidasiyaa xeeraa kessidi,

English Sentences: And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni Xoossaa Na7aa gidikko, ane duge guppa. Aissi giikko, Xoossaa maxaafai, Xoossai ba kiitanchchata neeyyo azazana qassi Eti ne tohoi shuchchan xubettenna mala, bantta kushiyan nena denttana yaagees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi zaaridi a, "Qassikka Xoossaa maxaafai, Godaa ne Xoossaa paaccoppa yaagees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi xalahe halaqai Yesuusa issi daro gita deriyaa xeeraa kessidi, sa7an de7iya kawotetta ubbaanne eta bonchchuwaa bessiis.

English Sentences: And saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bessidi a, "Neeni taayyo gulbbatada goinnikko, taani hagaa ubbaa neeyyo immana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yesuusi zaaridi a, "Laa ha Seexaanau haakka; aissi giikko, Xoossaa maxaafai, Godaayyo, ne Xoossaayyo goinna; a xalaalau ootta gees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, xalahe halaqai a aggi bayin, kiitanchchati yiidi, ayyo oottidosona.

English Sentences: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yohaannisi qashettidoogaa Yesuusi siyido wode, Galiila giyo biitti biis.

English Sentences: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:
Wolaitta Sentences: Naazireeteppe kiyidi, Qifirinaahooma katamaa biidi, yan de7iis; Qifirinaahoomi Zaabiloona biittaaninne Nifttaaleema biittan abbaa matan de7ees.

English Sentences: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegee hanidoogee hananabaa yootiya Isiyaasi giidoogee polettanaassa; hananabaa yootiya Isiyaasi hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: The land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Zaabiloona biittaaninne Nifttaaleema biittan, abbaa ogiyan Yorddaanoosa SHaafaappe hefintta baggan, Aihuda gidenna asai de7iyo Galiilan,

English Sentences: The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
Wolaitta Sentences: xuman de7iya asai wolqqaama poo7uwaa be7iis. Qassi haiquwaa kuwai de7iyo biittan uttidaageetuyyo poo7oi kiyiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wodiyaappe doommidi Yesuusi, "Intte nagaraappe simmite; aissi giikko, saluwaa kawotettai matattiis" giidi qaalaa yootuwaa doommiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Galiila Abbaa mataara aadhdhiiddi, naa77u ishantti PHeexiroosa giyo Simooninne a ishaa Inddiraasi, moliyaa oiqqiyaageeta gidido gishshau, gitiyaa abban yeggiyaageeta be7iis.

English Sentences: And he saith unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7idi eta, "Tana kaallite; taani inttena asa oiqqiyoogaa tamaarissana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they straightway left their nets, and followed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eti sohuwaarakka bantta gitiyaa yeggi bayidi, Yesuusa kaallidosona.

English Sentences: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaappe sinttaukko biiddi, hara naa77u ishantta, Zabddiyoosa naata Yaaqoobanne a ishaa Yohaannisa be7iis; eti bantta aawaa Zabddiyoosaara wolwolo giddon bantta gitiyaa giigissiyaageeta be7idi xeesiis.

English Sentences: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xeesin sohuwaarakka eti wolwoluwaanne bantta aawaa yeggi bayidi, Yesuusa kaallidosona.

English Sentences: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Aihuda woosa keettatun tamaarissiiddi, kawotettaa wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiiddinne qassi hargge ubbaappenne saho ubbaappe asaa pattiiddi, Galiila biitta ubban yuuyiis.

English Sentences: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.
Wolaitta Sentences: A woree Sooriyaa biittaa ubbaa gakkiis; asai dumma dumma harggiyan ohettidi harggida asaanne sahettida asa ubbaa, xalaheti oiqqido asaa, kaarettai oiqqido asaanne, qassi bollai silido asaa Yesuusakko ehiis; ehin i eta pattiis.

English Sentences: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem, and from Judaea, and from beyond Jordan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro asai Galiilappe, tammu katamatuppe, Yerusalaameppe, Yihudaappenne Yorddaanoosappe hefinttan de7iya biittaappe Yesuusa kaalliis.

English Sentences: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi daro asaa be7idi, deriyaa huuphiyaa kiyidi uttiis. Bana kaalliyaageeti baakko shiiqin,

English Sentences: And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: tamaarissuwaa doommidi, eta hagaadan yaagiis.

English Sentences: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bantta ayyaanan hiyyeesa gididoogaa eriyaageeti anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, saluwaa kawotettai etassa.

English Sentences: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kayyottiyaageeti anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, Xoossai eta minttettana.

English Sentences: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ashkketi anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, eti sa7aa laattana.

English Sentences: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.
Wolaitta Sentences: Namisettiyaageetinne saamettiyaageeti kattaa haattaa koyiyoogaadan, xillobaa oottanau laamotiyaageeti anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, Xoossai eta kalissana.

English Sentences: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maariyaageeti anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, Xoossai eta maarana.

English Sentences: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozanaa geeshshati anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, eti Xoossaa be7ana.

English Sentences: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa sigettiyaageeti anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, Xoossai eta, ba naata giidi xeesana.

English Sentences: Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettaa gishshau yedetettiyaageeti anjjettidaageeta; aissi giikko, saluwaa kawotettai etassa.

English Sentences: Blessed are ye, when men shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte tana kaalliyo gishshau, asai inttena boriyo wodenne waissiyo wode, qassi intte bolli iitabaa ubbaa wordduwan haasayiyo wode, intte anjjettidaageeta.

English Sentences: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intteyyo saluwan gita woitoi de7iyo gishshau, ufaittite; hashshu giite; aissi giikko, asai intteppe kase de7ida hananabaa yootiyaageetakka hegaadan waissiis.

English Sentences: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asa ubbaassi intte maxine mala; shin maxinee laqilaqana xayikko, naa77antto a waatidi laqilaqissanee? Kare olin, asi a yedhdhi hemettanaappe attin, wodeppe ainne go77enna.

English Sentences: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Sa7au intte poo7o mala; deriyaa huuphiyan keexettida katamai geemmana danddayenna.

English Sentences: Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xomppe oittidi, son de7iya asa ubbau poo7ana mala, xoqqiyaasan wottiyoogaappe attin, kere giddon qum77i wottiya asi baawa.

English Sentences: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, asi intte oottiyo lo77o oosuwaa be7idi, saluwan de7iya intte Aawaa galatana mala, intte poo7oi asa sinttan poo7o.

English Sentences: Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfil.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani Muuse higgiyaanne hananabaa yootiyaageeti tamaarissiyoogaa xaissanau yiidobaa intteyyo milatoppo; taani polanau yiidoogaappe attin, xaissanau yabeikke.

English Sentences: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani intteyyo tumaa odais; saloinne sa7ai aadhdhana gakkanaassi, qassi ubbabaikka polettana gakkanaassi, higgiyaappe issi qaalaikka woi issi pitaleekka xayenna.

English Sentences: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ha azazo ubbaappe guuxxiya issi azazuwaa kanttiya urai ooninne, qassi haratikka baagaadan oottanaadan tamaarissiya urai ooninne, saluwaa kawotettan ubbaappe guutta gidana; shin higgiyaa oottiyaageenne tamaarissiyaagee ooninne saluwaa kawotettan gita gidana.

English Sentences: For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani intteyyo odais; intte xillotettai higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetu xillotettaappenne Parisaawetu xillotettaappe darana xayikko, saluwaa kawotettaa intte mulekka gelekketa.

English Sentences: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Beni asaa, Asa woroppa; asa worida ooninne pirddettana giidoogaa siyideta.

English Sentences: But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; ba ishaa hanqqettiya ubbai pirddettana; ba ishaa cayiya ubbai yaa7aa pirddau shiiqana; qassi ba ishaa, Eeyyai giya ubbai Gaannabiyaa tamaa pirddau shiiqana.

English Sentences: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, neeni yarshshiyoosan yarshshishin, ne ishaa naaqqidobai neeyyo hegan hassayettikko,

English Sentences: Leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.
Wolaitta Sentences: ne yarshshuwaa he sohuwankka yegga bayada ba; kasetada ne ishaara sigettaichcha; hegaappe guyyiyan yaada, ne yarshshuwaa yarshsha.

English Sentences: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Nena mootiyaagaara pirdda keettaa baidda ogiyan elle aara sigettaichcha; hegee xayikko, i nena daanna sintti aattana; qassi daannai nena polisiyau aattidi immin, polisee nena qachchana.

English Sentences: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani neeyyo tumaa odais; neeni issi santtimee attennan, ne maqqaccuwaa wurssada qanxxana gakkanaassi, mulekka qasho keettaappe kiyakka.

English Sentences: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHaaramuxoppa giidoogaa siyideta.

English Sentences: But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; maccaaro xeellidi amottiya ubbai, ba wozana giddon he wode iira shaaramuxiis.

English Sentences: And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne ushachcha aifee nena nagara ootissikko, neeppe shoddada ola baya; aissi giikko, ne bollai muleera Gaannabiyaa taman olettanaagaappe, appe issoi xayiyoogee neeyyo keha.

English Sentences: And if thy right hand offend thee, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi ne ushachcha kushee nena nagara ootissikko, neeppe qanxxada ola baya; aissi giikko, ne bollai muleera Gaannabiyaa taman olettanaagaappe, appe issoi xayiyoogee neeyyo keha.

English Sentences: It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Qassi ba machchiyo yeddiya ooninne o yeddiyo paramaa immo geetettiis.

English Sentences: But I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; ba machchiyaa shaaramuxennan de7ishin yeddiya ooninne o shaaramuxa kessees; qassi azinai yeddido maccaasiyo ekkiya ooninne shaaramuxees.

English Sentences: Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Qassi beni asaa, Wordduwan caaqqoppa, shin ne Godau caaqqidoogaa pola giidoogaa siyideta.

English Sentences: But I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven; for it is God's throne:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; mulekka caaqqoppite; saloi Xoossaa kawotaa araataa gidiyo gishshau, saluwan mulekka caaqqoppitenne;

English Sentences: Nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.
Wolaitta Sentences: qassi sa7ai a gedee yedhdhiyoosaa gidiyo gishshau, sa7an caaqqoppite; qassi Yerusalaamee gita kawuwaa katama gidiyo gishshau, Yerusalaamenkka caaqqoppite.

English Sentences: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni issi binnaanakka bootta woi karetta kessanau danddayenna gishshau, ne huuphiyankka caaqqoppa.

English Sentences: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte, Ee woi, CHii giite; hageetuppe hara caaqoi xalahe halaqaappe yees.

English Sentences: Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aife gishshaa aife; achcha gishshaa achcha giidoogaa siyideta.

English Sentences: But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; intteyyo iitabaa oottiya uraa diggoppite; ooninne ne ushachcha bagga qinxxalliyaa baqqikko, ne haddirssa bagga qinxxalliyaakka a bessa;

English Sentences: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also.
Wolaitta Sentences: ne qoliyaa ekkanau issi urai nena mootikko, he urai ne kootiyaakka ekko.

English Sentences: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooninne nena issi saate ogiyaa banaara wolqqan efiikko, aara naa77u saate ogiyaa ba.

English Sentences: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena woossiya urau imma; qassi neeppe tal77ana koyiya uraukka diggoppa.

English Sentences: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ne shooruwaa siiqa; ne morkkiyaa morkka giidoogaa siyideta.

English Sentences: But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; saluwan de7iya intte Aawau naata gidana mala, intte morkketa siiqite; inttena qanggiyaageetakka anjjite; inttena ixxiyaageetuyyo lo77obaa oottite; inttena waissiyaageetuyyookka Xoossaa woossite;

English Sentences: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, iita asaukka lo77o asaukka Xoossai ba awaa awaxxissees; qassi xillotuyyookka nagaranchchatuyyookka ba iraa bukissees.

English Sentences: For if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, intte inttena siiqiyaageetu xalaalaa siiqikko, intteyyo ai woitoi de7ii? Harai atto, giiraa ekkiyaageetikka hegaadan oottoosona.

English Sentences: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the publicans so?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte intte ishanttu xalaalaa sarotikko, harati oottiyoogaappe aadhdhiyaabaa ai oottidetii? Harai atto, Xoossaa ammanenna asaikka hegaadan oottees.

English Sentences: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, saluwan de7iya intte Aawai bali bainnaagaa gidiyoogaadan, inttekka bali bainnaageeta gidite.

English Sentences: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte ammano oosuwaa asa bessanau asa sinttan oottenna mala naagettite; hegee xayikko, saluwan de7iya intte Aawai intteyyo woituwaa immenna.

English Sentences: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, intte aibakko hiyyeesau immiyo wode, lo77o milatiya iitati banttana bonchchissanau, Aihuda woosa keettatuuninne ogetun awaajissiyoogaadan awaajissoppite; taani intteyyo tumaa odais; eti bantta woituwaa ekkiichchidosona.

English Sentences: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte hiyyeesau immiyo wode, geeman immanaadan, intte ushachcha kushee oottiyoogaa intte haddirssa kushee eroppo;

English Sentences: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.
Wolaitta Sentences: geeman be7iya intte Aawai intteyyo qoncciyan immana.

English Sentences: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossaa woossiiddi, lo77o milatiya iitatudan hanoppite; aissi giikko, banttana asi be7ana mala; Aihuda woosa keettatuuninne ogetu doonan eqqidi, Xoossaa woossiyoogaa dosoosona; taani intteyyo tumaa odais; eti bantta woituwaa muleera ekkiichchidosona.

English Sentences: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte Xoossaa woossiyo wode, intte soo gelite; kariyaa gorddidi, geeman de7iya intte Aawaa woossite; geeman be7iya intte Aawai intteyyo qoncciyan immana.

English Sentences: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossaa intte woossiyo wode, Xoossaa ammanenna asaagaadan, mela biddoppite; aissi giikko, Xoossaa ammanenna asai adussidi Xoossaa woossin siyees giidi qoppees.

English Sentences: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, he asaagaadan hanoppite; aissi giikko, intte Aawai inttena koshshiyaagaa intte woossanaappe kasetidi erees.

English Sentences: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi intte hagaadan yaagidi, Xoossaa woossite; Saluwan de7iya nu Aawau, ne geeshsha sunttai anjjetto.

English Sentences: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne kawotettai yo; ne shenee saluwan hanidoogaadan, sa7ankka hano.

English Sentences: Give us this day our daily bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hachchi hachchi koshshiya qumaa nuuyyo hachchi imma.

English Sentences: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni nuna naaqqidaageetuyyo atto giyoogaadan, neenikka nu naaquwaa atto ga.

English Sentences: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuna iitabaappe ashshanaappe attin, paacen gelissoppa. Kawotettai, wolqqainne bonchchoi merinaukka neessa. Amin77i yaagite.

English Sentences: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte inttena naaqqida hara asaa naaquwaa atto giikko, saluwan de7iya intte Aawaikka intteyyo atto gaana.

English Sentences: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte inttena naaqqida hara asaa naaquwaa atto gaana xayikko, intte Aawaikka intte naaquwaa atto geenna.

English Sentences: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Qassi intte xoomiyo wode, lo77o milatiya iitatudan, kayyottiyaabaa milatoppite; aissi giikko, eti xoomiyoogaa asai be7ana mala, bantta som77uwaa bullaalissoosona; taani intteyyo tumaa odais; eti bantta woituwaa muleera ekkiichchidosona.

English Sentences: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin intte xoomiyo wode, intte Aawai intte xoomiyoogaa eranaappe attin,

English Sentences: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
Wolaitta Sentences: asi erenna mala, intte som77uwaa meeccite; intte huuphiyaakka tiyettite; yaatikko, geeman de7iya intte Aawai intte oottiyoogaa geeman be7idi, intteyyo qoncciyan immana.

English Sentences: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Bil77i bashshiyoosaaninne birati shiyiyoosan, kaisoikka bookkidi wuuqqiyoosan, sa7an intte huuphessi miishsha dagayoppite.

English Sentences: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin bil77inne qunoi bashshennasan, kaisoikka bookkidi wuuqqennasan intte huuphessi saluwan miishsha dagayite.

English Sentences: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ne wozanai ne miishshai de7iyoosan de7ana.

English Sentences: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Bollaa xomppee aifiyaa; hegaa gishshau, ne aifee payya gidikko, ne bolla ubbai poo7o gidana.

English Sentences: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ne aifee payya gidana xayikko, ne bolla ubbai xumana; simmi ne bolli de7iya poo7oi xumikko, xumai ai keenaa xumanddeeshsha!

English Sentences: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Naa77u godatuyyo haarettanau danddayiyai ooninne baawa; aissi giikko, woi issuwaa ixxidi, hinkkuwaa siiqana; woi issuwaa bonchchidi, hinkkuwaa karana; Xoossaassinne miishshaassi haarettanau danddayekketa.

English Sentences: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, taani intteyyo odais; intte paxa de7anau maanabaassinne uyanabaassi, woi intte bollau maayanabaassi hirggoppite; shemppoi qumappe aadhdhennee? Qassi bollai maayoppe aadhdhennee?

English Sentences: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
Wolaitta Sentences: Paalliya kafota xeellite; eti zerokkona; cakkokkona; gootarankka qolokkona; shin saluwan de7iya intte Aawai eta mizees; intte etappe keehi aadhdhekketii?

English Sentences: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte giddon keehi qoppidi, ba geesaa bolli issi wara gujjanau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aissi maayossi hirggeetii? Dembban de7iya ciishshati waani dicciyaakko, akeeki xeellite; eti daafurokkona woi puutto suqqokkona.

English Sentences: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani intteyyo odais; harai atto, Solomoni hegaa keena bonchchettidaagaa gidiiddi, he ciishshatuppe issuwaagaa malaa maayibeenna.

English Sentences: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin laafa ammanoi de7iyoogeetoo, Xoossai, hachchi de7idi, wontto coociyaa taman eexxiya dembbaa maataa maizziyaagee, inttena etaagaappe aattidi waati maizzennee?

English Sentences: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi, Nuuni ai maanee? Woi ai uyanee? Woi ai maayanee? yaagidi hirggoppite.

English Sentences: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, he ubbabaa Xoossaa ammanennaageeti darissidi koyoosona; he ubbai inttena koshshiyoogaa saluwan de7iya intte Aawai erees.

English Sentences: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin kasetidi, Xoossaa kawotettaanne a xillotettaa koyite; i intteyyo he ubbabaa immana.

English Sentences: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, wonttobau hirggoppite; aissi giikko, wonttoi bau hirggana; gallassa ubbaukka gidiya a huuphe waayee de7ees.

English Sentences: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai intte bolli pirddenna mala, inttekka haratu bolli pirddoppite.

English Sentences: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, intte haratu bolli pirddiyoogaadan, Xoossai intte bolli pirddana; qassi intte haratuyyo immanau makkiyooban i intteyyo makkana.

English Sentences: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aifiyan de7iya tuussaa be7akka; shin ne ishaa aifiyan de7iya suullaa aissi xeellai?

English Sentences: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam is in thine own eye?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woi ne aifiyan tuussai de7ishin, neeni ne ishaa, Taani ne aifiyaappe suullaa kessoo waanada gaanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laa ha lo77o milatiya iitau, kasetada ne aifiyaappe tuussaa kessargga; hegaappe guyyiyan, ne ishaa aifiyaappe suullaa kessanau geeshshada xeellana danddayaasa.

English Sentences: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Geeshshabaa kanatuyyo immoppite; eti guyye simmidi, inttena saxxana. Qassi inqquwaa giyo intte al77o shuchchaa gudunttatu sintti oloppite; eti bantta tohuwan yedhdhana.

English Sentences: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Woossite; intte ekkana. Koyite; intte demmana. Kare yiidi xeesite; intteyyo karee dooyettana.

English Sentences: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, woossiya ubbai ekkana; koyiya urai demmana; qassi kare yiidi xeesiya urau karee dooyettana.

English Sentences: Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woi intte giddon ba na7i, Oitta imma giikko, shuchcha immiya aawu de7ii?

English Sentences: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi, Mole imma giikko, ayyo shooshsha immanee?

English Sentences: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte iita gidiiddi, intte naatussi lo77obaa immiyoogaa erikko, yaatin, saluwan de7iya intte Aawai bana woossiyaageetussi lo77obaa waati darissidi immanddeeshsha!

English Sentences: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, hara asi intteyyo oottanau koyiyo ubbabaa inttekka asau oottite; aissi giikko, Muuse higgiyaa birshshettainne hananabaa yootiyaageeti tamaarissiyoogee hegaa.

English Sentences: Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Un77o penggiyaara gelite. Aissi giikko, bashshau efiya penggee aaho; ogeekka woggaa. Hegaara geliya asaikka daro.

English Sentences: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aissi giikko, de7uwau efiya penggee un77o; ogeekka xuntta. Qassi hegaara biya asatikka amaridaageeta.

English Sentences: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Bolla baggaara dorssa milatidi, inttekko yiya wordduwaa hananabaa yootiyaageetuppe naagettite; shin tumaappe eti garssa baggaara wanggireellotu mala.

English Sentences: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti aifiyo aifiyan intte eta erana; aguntti woine giyo turaa aife aifenna; gom77oreekka balase giyo mittaa aife aifenna.

English Sentences: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, lo77o mitta ubbai lo77o aife aifees; shin iita mitti iita aife aifees.

English Sentences: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o mitti iita aife aifanau danddayenna; qassi iita mittikka lo77o aife aifanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o aife aifenna mitta ubbai qanxxettidi, taman yegettana.

English Sentences: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, intte eti aifiyo aifiyan eta erana.

English Sentences: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Saluwan de7iya ta Aawai giidoogaa oottiya urai saluwaa gelanaappe attin, Ta Godau, ta Godau giya ubbai gelenna.

English Sentences: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works?
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassi daro asai tana, Nu Godau, nu Godau, nuuni ne sunttan hananabaa yootibookkonii? Ne sunttan xalaheta kessibookkonii? Qassi nuuni Xoossai oottiyo malaataa ne sunttan oottibookkonii? yaagana.

English Sentences: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani he wode eta, Taani inttena mulekka erikke; iitabaa oottiyaageeti intte ta matappe haakkite yaagana.

English Sentences: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, hagaa ta qaalaa siyidi oottiya ubbai shuchchan ba keettaa keexxida wozannaama asa mala.

English Sentences: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.
Wolaitta Sentences: Irai bukkiis; di7oi di77iis; carkkoikka carkkidi, he keettaa sugiis. SHin keettai shuchchan keexettido gishshau kunddibeenna.

English Sentences: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hagaa ta qaalaa siyidi oottenna asai ubbai, ba keettaa shafiyan keexxida eeyya asa mala.

English Sentences: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Irai bukkiis; di7oi di77iis; carkkoikka carkkidi, he keettaa sugin, keettai kunddiis. He keettai wolqqaama kunddettaa kunddiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi ba haasayiyoogaa wurssido wode, asai i tamaarissiyoogan garamettiis.

English Sentences: For he taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, i eta tamaarissiiddi, higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetudan gidennan, bau alaafetettai de7iyo asadan tamaarissees.

English Sentences: When he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi deriyaappe wodhdhido wode, daro asai a kaalliis.

English Sentences: And, behold, there came a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inchchirichchai oiqqido issi bitanee Yesuusakko yiidi, a sinttan gulbbatidi, "Godau, neeni koyikko, tana pattanau danddayaasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou clean. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi ba kushiyaa yeddidi, a bochchidi, "Taani koyais; paxa" yaagiis. Yaagin sohuwaarakka inchchirichchai bitaniyaa yeddi aggiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi a, "Simmi hagaa ooyyoonne yootoppa; shin qeesiyaakko baada ne bollaa a bessa; neeni paxidoogaa asaa erissanau Muusee azazido yarshshuwaa yarshsha" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Qifirinaahooma katamaa gelido wode, issi mato halaqai akko yiidi,

English Sentences: And saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta Godau, ta ashkkaraa asatettai silin, daro sahettiiddi, son zin77iis; hai pattarkkiishsha" yaagidi woossiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus saith unto him, I will come and heal him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woossin Yesuusi, "Taani baada a pattana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin mato halaqai zaaridi yaagiis; "Ta Godau, nena ta soo gelissanau tau bessenna; shin neeni doona xalaalaa haasaya; ta ashkkarai paxana.

English Sentences: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this man, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani taappe bollaara de7iyaageetuyyo haarettiya asa; qassi taappe garssaara wotaaddarati de7oosona. Taani issuwaa, Ba giikko bees; qassi hinkkuwaa, Haaya giikko yees; ta ashkkaraa, Hagaa ootta giikko oottees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: When Jesus heard it, he marvelled, and said to them that followed, Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaa siyido wode garamettidi, bana kaalliya asaa hagaadan yaagiis; "Taani intteyyo tumaa odais; taani hagaa mala ammanuwaa harai atto, Israa7eela biittankka be7abeikke.

English Sentences: And I say unto you, That many shall come from the east and west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intteyyo odais; daro asai arshshoppenne arggoppe yiidi, Abrahaamaara, Yisaaqaaranne Yaaqoobaara saluwaa kawotettan issippe uttana.

English Sentences: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin kawotettan de7anau bessiyo asai xumau kare olettana; hegan eti yeekkananne bantta achchaa garccana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus said unto the centurion, Go thy way; and as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee. And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi mato halaqaa, "Ne soo ba; neeni ammanidoogaadan neeyyo hanana" yaagiis; yaagin mato halaqaa ashkkarai he saatenkka paxi aggiis.

English Sentences: And when Jesus was come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother laid, and sick of a fever.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi PHeexiroosa soo biidi, a bollotiyaa qoxonne misho harggada zin77idaaro be7iis.

English Sentences: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.
Wolaitta Sentences: I kushiyaa i bochchin, qoxoinne mishoi o aggi bayiis; aggi bayin, a denddada ayyo oottaasu.

English Sentences: When the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with his word, and healed all that were sick:
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai omariyo wode, asai xalaheti oiqqido daro asaa Yesuusakko ehiis;

English Sentences: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bare our sicknesses.
Wolaitta Sentences: hananabaa yootiya Isiyaasi, "I nu sahuwaa bau ekkiis; qassi nu harggiyaakka tookkiis" giidoogee polettana mala, Yesuusi tuna ayyaanata ba qaalan kessidi, harggida asa ubbaakka pattiis.

English Sentences: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi daro asai ba matan yuuyi aadhdhidi eqqidoogaa be7idi, abbaappe hefintti pinnana mala, ba erissiyo ashkkarata azaziis.

English Sentences: And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
Wolaitta Sentences: Higgiyaa tamaarissiya issoi akko yiidi, "Tamaarissiyaagoo, neeni biyoosaa ubbaa taani nena kaallana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus saith unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi a, "Worakanatussi ollai de7ees; kafotussikka keettai de7ees; shin taani, Asa Na7ai, zin77ada shemppa ekkiyoosikka tau baawa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi kaalliyaageetuppe issoi a, "Godau, taani kaseta baada ta aawaa moogoo?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But Jesus said unto him, Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi a, "Neeni tana kaalla; haiqqidaageeti bantta haiqqidaageeta moogona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi wolwoluwan gelin, erissiyo ashkkarati aara biidosona.

English Sentences: And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Beetai wolwoluwaa kumana gakkanaashin, sohuwaara abban wolqqaama gotee denddiis; shin Yesuusi xiskkiis.

English Sentences: And his disciples came to him, and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erissiyo ashkkarati akko biidi, xiskkuwaappe denttidosona; denttidi a, "Godau, nuuni xayoos; nuna ashsharkkii" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eta, "Ha ammanoi paccidoogeetoo, aissi yayyeetii?" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan denddidi, gotiyaanne beetaa aggite gin, goteenne beetai woppu giidosona.

English Sentences: But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai garamettidi, "Hagee laa harai atto, goteenne beetai azazettiyoogee aiba asee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi abbaappe hefinttan de7iya Gerggesenoona giyo biittaa pinniis; xalaheti oiqqido naa77u asati he biittan de7oosona; asa moogiyo gonggoluwaappe eti kiyidi, aara gaittidosona. Eti daro wolqqaama gidiyo gishshau, ooninne he ogiyaara aadhdhanau danddayibeenna.

English Sentences: And, behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God? art thou come hither to torment us before the time?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, "Xoossaa Na7au, nunanne nenanne aibee gattiyai? Wodee gakkennan nuna qaxxayanau yaadii?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe haahuwan gudunttaa wudee heemettees.

English Sentences: So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xalaheti Yesuusa, "Neeni nuna kessanabaa gidikko, hini gudunttaa wudiyaa giddo yeddarkkii" yaagidi woossidosona.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Go. And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eta, "Biite" gin eti bitaniyaappe kiyidi biidi, gudunttatun gelidosona. Gelin gudunttaa wudee ubbai kakaa huuphiyaara jaamiiddi, abban gelidi, meetetti bayiis.

English Sentences: And they that kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told every thing, and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gudunttaa wudiyaa heemmiyaageeti baqatidi, katamaa biidosona; biidi xalaheti oiqqido asati hanidobaa ubbaa yootidosona.

English Sentences: And, behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootin kataman de7iya asai ubbai Yesuusaara gaittanau kiyiis; a be7ido wode, ba biittaappe baana mala woossiis.

English Sentences: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi wolwoluwan gelidi, abbaa pinnidi, ba katamaa biis.

English Sentences: And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amarida asati bollai silido issi bitaniyaa halan tookkidi, Yesuusakko ehiidosona; Yesuusi eta ammanuwaa be7idi, bollai silido bitaniyaa, "Ta na7au, yayyoppa; ne nagarai atto geetettiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetuppe issooti issooti bantta wozanan, "Laa ha bitanee Xoossaa bolli iitabaa haasayeesittennee!" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eta qofaa eridi, eta hagaadan yaagiis; "Intte intte wozanan hegaadan iitabaa aissi qoppeetii?

English Sentences: For whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne nagarai atto geetettiis giyoogee mateeyye? Woi, Dendda eqqada hemetta giyoogee matee?

English Sentences: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin sa7aa bollan nagara atto gaanau taayyo, Asa Na7aayyo, alaafetettai de7iyoogaa taani inttena erissana" yaagidi, hegaappe he bollai silido bitaniyaa, "Dendda eqqa; yaatada ne halaa tookkada, ne soo ba" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he arose, and departed to his house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin silida bitanee denddi eqqidi, ba soo biis.

English Sentences: But when the multitudes saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin daro asai hegaa be7idi yayyiis; yayyidi asaayyo hagaa mala alaafetettaa immida Xoossaa galatiis.

English Sentences: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaara aadhdhiiddi, Maatiyoosa giyoogee giiraa giiriyoosan uttidaagaa demmidi a, "Tana kaalla" yaagiis. Yaagin Maatiyoosi denddi eqqidi, a kaalliis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi maatiyoosa son qumaa maanau uttidaashin, giiraa ekkiya daro asatinne nagaranchchati yiidi, aaranne i erissiyo ashkkaratuura issippe uttidosona.

English Sentences: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi Parisaaweti hegaa be7idi, Yesuusi erissiyo ashkkarata, "Inttena tamaarissiyaagee giiraa ekkiyaageetuuranne nagaranchchatuura qumaa aissi issippe mii?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: But when Jesus heard that, he said unto them, They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi eti giyoogaa siyidi, "Hargganchchatussippe attin, payyatuyyo aakime koshshenna.

English Sentences: But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin intte biidi, Xoossaa maxaafai, Taani maarotettaa koyaisippe attin, yarshshuwaa koyikke giyoogee woigiyoogaakkonne erite; aissi giikko, taani nagaranchchata xeesanau yiidoogaappe attin, xillota xeesanau yabeikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Yohaannisi erissiyo ashkkarati Yesuusakko yiidi, "Nuuninne Parssaaweti xoomoos; shin neeni erissiyo ashkkarati aissi xoomokkonaa?" yaagidi a oichchidosona.

English Sentences: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eta hagaadan yaagiis; "Bullachchaa yiida asati machchiyo ekkiyaagee banttanaara de7ishin, kayyottanau danddayiyoonaa? Danddayokkona; shin machchiyo ekkiyaagaa eta matappe efaana wodee yaana; eti he wode xoomana.

English Sentences: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ceega maayo bolli ooratta woto wotti sikkiya asi baawa; aissi giikko, he wotoi maayuwaa peererettana; peerettaikka kaseegaappe darana.

English Sentences: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ho77o woine eessa ceega ogoron naaqqiya asi baawa. SHin naaqqikko, he woiniyaa eessai ogoruwaa daakkana; baukka gukkana; ogoroikka moorettana. SHin, ho77o woine eessa ooratta ogoron naaqqeettees; naa77aikka moorettokkona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi etayyo hegaa odishin, Aihuda halaqatuppe issoi akko yiidi, a sinttan gulbbatidi, "Ta na7iyaa ha77i haiqqaasu; shin neeni yaada ne kushiyaa i bolli wottarkkii; haiquwaappe a paxana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jesus arose, and followed him, and so did his disciples.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yesuusi denddidi, ba erissiyo ashkkaratuura issippe a kaallidi biis.

English Sentences: And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the hem of his garment:
Wolaitta Sentences: Biishin tammanne naa77u laittaasappe doommidi, i bollaappe suuttai goggiyo issi maccaasiyaa guyyeera shiiqada, Yesuusa afalaa macaraa bochchaasu.

English Sentences: For she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, a ba wozanan, "Taani a afalaa xalaalaa bochchikko paxana" yaagada qoppaasu.

English Sentences: But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole from that hour.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yesuusi simmidi o xeellidi, "Ta na7ee, yayyoppa; nena ne ammanoi pattiis" yaagiis. He sohuwaarakka maccaasiyaa paxa aggaasu.

English Sentences: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi Aihuda halaqaa soo gakkido wode, yeehuwan dinkkiyaa punniya asaanne yeekkiya asaa be7idi,

English Sentences: He said unto them, Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Kare kiyite; guutta na7iyaa xiskkaasuppe attin, haiqqabeikku" yaagiis. Yaagin asai a bolli keehi miicciis.

English Sentences: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin daro asaa kare i kessidoogaappe guyyiyan, soo gelidi, na7ee kushiyaa oiqqiis; oiqqin na7iyaa dendda aggaasu.

English Sentences: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.
Wolaitta Sentences: He odoi he biitta ubbaa gakkiis.

English Sentences: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, Thou son of David, have mercy on us.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi hegaara aadhdhidi biishin, naa77u qooqeti bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, "Daawita na7au, nuna maararkkii" yaagiiddi a kaallidosona.

English Sentences: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yea, Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi soo gelido wode, qooqeti akko yiidosona; yin Yesuusi eta, "Taani hagaa oottanau danddayiyoogaa ammaneetii?" yaagiis. Eti, "Ee Godau" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yesuusi eta aifiyaa bochchidi eta, "Intteyyo intte ammanuwaadan hano" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta aifee dooyetti aggiis; Yesuusi etayyo, "Hagaa ooyyoonne odoppite" yaagidi minttidi yootiis.

English Sentences: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin asati biidi, he biitta ubban Yesuusabaa odidosona.

English Sentences: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti kiyidi biishin, amarida asati xalahee oiqqin duudida bitaniyaa Yesuusakko ehiidosona.

English Sentences: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi xalahiyaa kessidoogaappe guyyiyan, duude bitanee haasayiis. Asai, "Hagee oorattabaa; hagaa malabai Israa7eela biittan mulekka hanibeenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Parisaaweti, "I xalahetu halaqaa wolqqan xalaheta kessees" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi eta Aihuda woosa keettatun tamaarissiiddinne kawotettaa wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiiddi, qassi hargge ubbaappenne saho ubbaappe asa pattiiddi, wogga katamatuuninne qeeri katamatun ubban yuuyiis.

English Sentences: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro asaa be7idi, heemmiya asi bainna dorssadan asai hirggiyo gishshaunne asaa maaddiyaabi bainna gishshau, asaayyo qarettiis.

English Sentences: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi ba erissiyo ashkkarata, "Kattai daro; shin cakkiya asai guutta.

English Sentences: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi kattaa Godai kattaa cakkanau oosanchcha yeddana mala, a woossite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples, he gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi ba tammanne naa77u erissiyo ashkkarata xeesidi, eti tuna ayyaanaa kessana mala, qassi hargge ubbaanne saho ubbaa pattana mala, etayyo maataa immiis.

English Sentences: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi kiittido tammanne naa77atu sunttai, koiroogee PHeexiroosa giyo Simoonanne a ishaa Inddiraasa, Zabddiyoosa naata ishantta, Yaaqoobanne Yohaannisa,

English Sentences: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;
Wolaitta Sentences: Piliphphoosanne Barttalamoosa, Toomaasanne giiraa ekkiya Maatiyoosa, Ilppiyoosa na7aa Yaaqoobanne Taaddiyoosa giyo Libddiyoosa;

English Sentences: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: ba biittau mishettiya Simoonanne Yesuusa aattidi immida Asqqorootu Yihudaa.

English Sentences: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yesuusi ha tammanne naa77ata hagaadan yaagidi kiittiis; "Aihuda gidenna asaa biitti booppite; qassi Samaaretu katamaakka geloppite;

English Sentences: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: hegaa gishshaa bayida dorssaakko, Israa7eela asaakko biite.

English Sentences: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biidi, Saluwaa kawotettai matattiis yaagidi yootite.

English Sentences: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hargganchchata pattite; haiqqidaageeta haiquwaappe denttite; inchchirichchai oiqqidoogeetakka pattite; xalahetakka kessite. Intte coo ekkideta; coo immite.

English Sentences: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,
Wolaitta Sentences: Worqqa woi bira woi santtime intte kiisiyan oiqqoppite;

English Sentences: Nor scrip for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: woi ogiyau qarcciita, woi naa77antto qole, woi caamma woi xam77a oiqqoppite. Aissi giikko, oosanchchau koshshiyaabaa immanau bessees.

English Sentences: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
